meanings.definition: The quality or state of being suitable for living in.
meanings.sent1: The livablenesses of the new apartment made it a perfect choice for the family.
meanings.sent2: The city's livablenesses attract many people to move there.
meanings.sent3: The real estate agent joked that the house's livablenesses were so great, even the plants would want to live there.
meanings.sent4: The livablenesses of the neighborhood were like a warm hug welcoming everyone in.
meanings.sent5: The brochure highlighted the livablenesses of the town, painting a picture of a cozy and inviting community.

meanings.definition: The condition of being comfortable or pleasant to live in.
meanings.sent1: The livablenesses of the hotel room made the guests feel right at home.
meanings.sent2: The livablenesses of the climate in that region make it a popular destination for retirees.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to approve of the livablenesses of the new cat bed, purring contentedly.
meanings.sent4: The livablenesses of the hammock on a sunny day were like a dream come true.
meanings.sent5: The livablenesses of the small town were so charming that visitors never wanted to leave.
